title: Assessing multiplex tiling PCR sequencing approaches for detecting genomic variants of SARS-CoV-2 in municipal wastewater
title_html: Assessing multiplex tiling PCR sequencing approaches for detecting genomic variants of SARS-CoV-2 in municipal wastewater

source.body:
For ARTIC V3 400bp primer scheme and midnight 1200bp primer scheme (sequencing with nanopore), continue with steps 7-16.
For Swift 150bp primer scheme (sequencing with Illumina), continue with steps 17-26.

per sample.

Keep the tubes on the magnet and wash the beads with
of freshly prepared 80% ethanol without disturbing the pellet. Incubate for
and pipette off the ethanol.

Spin down and place the tubes on the magnet. Pipette off any residual ethanol. Allow to air dry for about
, but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking.

nuclease-free water. Incubate for
at

Pellet the beads on a magnetic rack until the eluate is clear and colourless.

Remove and retain
of eluate containing the DNA library per tube into new 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes.

Quantify
of each eluted sample using a Qubit fluorometer with Qubit dsDNA HS Assay Kit.

.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description: Open the MinION Mk1B lid and slide the flow cell under the clip. Press down firmly on the flow cell to ensure correct thermal and electrical contact.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description: Slide the priming port cover clockwise to open the priming port.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description: After opening the priming port, check for a small air bubble under the cover. Draw back a small volume to remove any bubbles (a few μl).

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description:
To prepare the flow cell priming mix, add
of thawed and mixed Flush Tether (FLT) directly to the tube of thawed and mixed Flush Buffer (FB), and mix by vortexing at
.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description:
Load
of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port, avoiding the introduction of air bubbles. Wait for
. During this time, prepare the library for loading by following the steps below.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description: Thoroughly mix the contents of the Loading Beads (LB) by pipetting.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description:
In a new tube, prepare the library for loading as follows:

ReagentVolume
Sequencing Buffer (SQB)37.5 μl
Loading Beads (LB), mixed immediately before use25.5 μl
DNA library (50 fmol)12 μl
Total75 μl

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description: Gently lift the SpotON sample port cover to make the SpotON sample port accessible.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description:
Load
of the priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port (not the SpotON sample port), avoiding the introduction of air bubbles.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description: Mix the prepared library gently by pipetting up and down just prior to loading.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description:
Add
of sample to the flow cell via the SpotON sample port in a dropwise fashion. Ensure each drop flows into the port before adding the next.

source.title: Priming and loading the SpotON flowcell (nanopore)

source.description: Gently replace the SpotON sample port cover, making sure the bung enters the SpotON port, close the priming port and replace the MinION Mk1B lid.

description:
In this work, we aim to access the performance of three different multiplex primer schemes, i.e. Swift amplicon SARS-CoV-2 panel (150bp amplicons), ARTIC V3 panel (400bp amplicons), and SARS-CoV-2 midnight panel (1200bp amplicons), for metatranscriptomic sequencing of SARS-CoV-2 for influent wastewater and primary sludge.

This protocol is adapted from the Swift amplicon™ SARS-COV-2 protocol (150bp amplicon), ARTIC V3 protocol (400bp amplicon), and "midnight" protocol (1200bp amplicon).

Sequencing libraries are prepared with 1) Oxford Nanopore Ligation Sequencing Kit (SQK-LSK109) with Native Barcoding kit (EXP-NEB104 and EXP-NEB114), or 2) NEBNext® Ultra™ II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina® with NEBNext® Multiplex Oligos for Illumina®.

Links to the protocols are:
Swift amplicon protocol (150bp): https://swiftbiosci.com/swift-amplicon-sars-cov-2-panel/
ARTIC V3 protocol (400bp): https://www.protocols.io/view/ncov-2019-sequencing-protocol-v3-locost-bh42j8ye?version_warning=no
"midnight" protocol V4 (1200bp): dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bh7hj9j6
